questions.prompt: Given z = x²y and x = t², y = t³, what is dz/dt using the chain rule?
questions.explanation: Using the chain rule: dz/dt = (∂z/∂x)(dx/dt) + (∂z/∂y)(dy/dt). We have ∂z/∂x = 2xy, ∂z/∂y = x², dx/dt = 2t, dy/dt = 3t². Substituting x = t² and y = t³: dz/dt = 2(t²)(t³)·2t + (t²)²·3t² = 4t⁶ + 3t⁶ = 7t⁶. This can be verified by direct substitution: z = (t²)²(t³) = t⁷, so dz/dt = 7t⁶.

questions.prompt: For f(x,y) = x³ + y³ - 3xy, what is f_xx + f_yy (the Laplacian)?
questions.explanation: f_x = 3x² - 3y, f_xx = 6x; f_y = 3y² - 3x, f_yy = 6y. Thus f_xx + f_yy = 6x + 6y

questions.prompt: What is the differential df for f(x,y,z) = x²yz?
questions.explanation: df = f_x dx + f_y dy + f_z dz = 2xyz dx + x²z dy + x²y dz
